summary: This is a civil complaint filed in the Southern District of New York by an anonymous plaintiff (Jane Doe) against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and Ghislaine Maxwell. The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Epstein and Maxwell beginning at age 16 in 1996. The complaint details the operations of the alleged sex trafficking ring, Epstein's 2008 plea deal, his 2019 arrest and death, and the specific abuse suffered by the plaintiff in New York and New Mexico. This is a civil complaint filed on November 12, 2019, by an anonymous plaintiff (Jane Doe) against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It details allegations of sexual assault, battery, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress against the plaintiff when she was a minor. The document also describes the plaintiff's attempts to report the crimes to the NYPD and FBI, and to Vanity Fair magazine, which were allegedly ignored or suppressed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The central defendant, described as a billionaire who operated a transcontinental sex trafficking network, sexually abusing the plaintiff and many other minors. He died in jail in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named defendant accused of participating in the sexual assault, battery, and false imprisonment of the plaintiff. The complaint alleges she recruited and assaulted the plaintiff alongside Epstein.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein. He swore an oath to serve as executor and filed documents related to Epstein's trust.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein. He swore an oath to serve as executor and filed documents related to Epstein's trust.

persons.name: Kenneth Marra
persons.context: A judge who previously found that Epstein sexually abused more than 30 minor girls between 1999 and 2007. His findings are cited in the complaint.

persons.name: Amber Sutherland
persons.context: New York Post reporter who interviewed Epstein in 2011; her article is cited where Epstein made comments about his status as a sex offender.

persons.name: James B. Stewart
persons.context: New York Times reporter who interviewed Epstein in 2018; his article is cited where Epstein made comments about the criminalization of sex with teenage girls.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Judge who formally dismissed the SDNY's indictment against Epstein on August 29, 2019, after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Martel Colon Miro
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed on August 8, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Gulnora Tali
persons.context: One of the witnesses to Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, executed on August 8, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named defendant accused of sexually assaulting, battering, and falsely imprisoning the plaintiff when she was a young girl. The complaint details his alleged abuse and intimidation tactics.

persons.name: Plaintiff (Jane Doe)
persons.context: The anonymous plaintiff who alleges she was sexually assaulted, battered, and falsely imprisoned by Epstein and Maxwell as a 16-year-old. She reported the crimes to the NYPD, FBI, and Vanity Fair.

connections.description: Described as working in concert to operate a sex trafficking network. Maxwell managed the network and recruited girls for Epstein's sexual gratification and that of others.
Indyke is an executor of Epstein's estate, appointed to administer it after Epstein's death.
Kahn is an executor of Epstein's estate, appointed to administer it after Epstein's death.
Both served as co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, filing documents together in the Virgin Islands probate court.
Maxwell is accused of recruiting, grooming, and sexually assaulting the plaintiff when she was a minor.
Epstein is accused of sexually trafficking, grooming, and assaulting the plaintiff when she was a minor.

Accused of jointly recruiting, assaulting, battering, and falsely imprisoning the plaintiff. They allegedly embarked on a campaign to destroy the plaintiff's reputation after she spoke to Vanity Fair.
Epstein is accused of being the primary perpetrator of sexual assault, battery, and false imprisonment against the plaintiff when she was a minor.

events.title: Start of Sex Trafficking Ring
events.description: The complaint alleges Epstein's sex trafficking ring started at least as early as this year.

events.title: Abuse of Plaintiff in New York and New Mexico
events.description: The plaintiff, age 16, was recruited, groomed, and sexually abused by Epstein and Maxwell in New York City and at Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a single Florida state charge of procuring a minor for prostitution and entered a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with federal prosecutors, serving a controversial 13-month jail term.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest by SDNY
events.description: Epstein was arrested on a sealed indictment from the Southern District of New York charging him with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking.

events.title: Epstein Signs Will in Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executed his last will and testament at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Dismissal of Criminal Case
events.description: U.S. District Judge Richard Berman formally dismissed the SDNY indictment against Epstein following his death, terminating the criminal action.

events.title: Epstein Estate Probated
events.description: The Superior Court of the Virgin Islands authorized Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn to administer Epstein's estate.

events.title: Termination of Criminal Action Against Epstein
events.description: A criminal action against Jeffrey Epstein related to the same sex trafficking enterprise from which the plaintiff's causes of action arise was terminated. This date is cited to meet the statute of limitations under New York law.

events.title: Filing of Civil Complaint
events.description: The plaintiff filed this civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in the U.S. District Court.

events.title: Plaintiff Reports Abuse to NYPD and FBI
events.description: The plaintiff reported her sexual assault to the NYPD's Sixth Precinct, which referred her to the FBI. She called the FBI to make a report, but authorities allegedly ignored her and took no action.

events.title: Plaintiff Contacts Vanity Fair
events.description: Frustrated by inaction from authorities, the plaintiff shared her story with Vanity Fair magazine. Epstein allegedly threatened and intimidated the magazine, which then published a profile of him without mentioning the plaintiff's allegations.

events.title: Campaign of Intimidation
events.description: After learning the plaintiff spoke to Vanity Fair, Epstein and Maxwell embarked on a campaign to destroy her reputation, causing her to fear for her safety and leave New York.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021 (Epstein's New York mansion)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico 87056 (Epstein's New Mexico ranch)
Southern District of New York (venue for the lawsuit)
Palm Beach, Florida (location of prior abuse mentioned)
United States Virgin Islands (Epstein's domicile at death, location of probate)
Paris, France (mentioned as a location of an Epstein residence)
Great St. James Island (Epstein's private island)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (where Epstein was held and died)
Sixth Precinct of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
keyFacts: The plaintiff alleges she was sexually trafficked and abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell beginning when she was 16 years old in 1996.

The complaint describes a detailed, transcontinental sex trafficking operation run by Epstein and managed by Maxwell, involving the recruitment of hundreds of young girls for Epstein and other powerful individuals.
Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with Florida federal prosecutors is characterized as a "shockingly minimal charge" that allowed his enterprise to continue.
Specific abusive incidents are described, including the plaintiff being isolated at Epstein's remote New Mexico ranch where both Epstein and Maxwell assaulted her.
The lawsuit is filed under the New York Child Victims Act, which extended the statute of limitations for child sex abuse cases.
The plaintiff alleges she was sexually assaulted, battered, and falsely imprisoned by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell when she was a 16-year-old child.
The plaintiff reported the assaults to the NYPD and FBI, but authorities allegedly ignored her reports, failing to take action.
The plaintiff also shared her story with Vanity Fair magazine, but Epstein allegedly threatened the magazine, resulting in a profile that omitted her allegations.
After speaking to Vanity Fair, Epstein and Maxwell allegedly began a campaign to destroy the plaintiff's reputation, causing her to flee New York out of fear.
The civil complaint was filed on November 12, 2019, citing the termination of a related criminal action against Epstein on August 29, 2019, to satisfy the statute of limitations.
